content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

Looking at the main target image, I can see a structure with the following characteristics:

## Count & Layers
- The structure has 9 blocks total
- It has 3 distinct layers:
  1. Bottom layer: 3 orange triangular wedges and 3 blue cubic blocks forming a cross shape
  2. Middle layer: 1 orange cylindrical block standing vertically
  3. Top layer: 1 orange triangular roof piece

## Spatial Relationships
- The blue blocks form a T-shaped core (or cross-shaped when viewed from above)
- The vertical orange cylinder sits on top of the central blue block
- The three orange triangular wedges extend outward from the blue core in three directions
- The orange triangular roof piece sits atop the vertical cylinder

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

Based on the structure, I need the following blocks:

1. Blue Blocks:
   - 3× blue cubic blocks (using index 2) - these form the T-shaped base

2. Orange Blocks:
   - 1× orange vertical cylinder (index 4) - forms the middle section
   - 3× orange triangular wedges (index 11) - surround the base
   - 1× orange triangular roof (index 11) - forms the top

# Assembly Order

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 2
   Step2: Move block with index 2
   Step3: Move block with index 2
   Step4: Move block with index 11
   Step5: Move block with index 11
   Step6: Move block with index 11
   Step7: Move block with index 4
   Step8: Move block with index 11
}
```

This sequence first creates the T-shaped blue foundation, then adds the triangular wedges around it, followed by the vertical cylinder, and finally topped with the triangular roof piece.
